cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning northeast across the Southeast U.S. toward the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northeastern Gulf Coast near the Florida Panhandle

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle through Georgia, the Carolinas, Chesapeake Bay and Mid-Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible, mainly below tropical-storm force (≤ 39 mph) with only a 7% chance of reaching gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay, generally below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 2–5 inches of rain as the system’s remnant core passes on Friday, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and river/urban flooding impacts to port logistics
